cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 475 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to sweep northeast across the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana coast, roughly between Intracoastal City and the Mississippi River Delta

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA to the Alabama/Florida border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from coastal Louisiana eastward to the Alabama/Florida border
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) possible Friday night into early Saturday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–3 ft of surge possible along Plaquemines Parish coast and within the lower Mississippi River Delta, especially at high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated amounts up to 12 inches, creating flash-flood risk
weather_observation.other_hazards: Scattered tornadoes possible beginning Friday afternoon
